result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mathew L. Larson

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:38 AM Defendant Mathew L. Larson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Mathew L. Larson.  Attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:11 PM Defendant Mathew L. Larson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by phone for Mathew L. Larson.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing requested by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:13 PM  Defendant Mathew L. Larson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

3:47 PM  Defendant Mathew L. Larson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for Mathew L. Larson.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $500.00 cash bond set with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 3pm.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint if released.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. May not possess any dangerous weapons or firearms.
